title: Sources: Alabama names Simpson starting QB
content: Alabama players were informed that Ty Simpson would be the team's starting quarterback on Monday, sources said.

title: Gruden wins key Nevada ruling in NFL emails suit
content: The Nevada Supreme Court on Monday sided with former Las Vegas Raiders coach Jon Gruden in his lawsuit alleging the NFL leaked damaging emails to the media before he resigned from the team in 2021.

title: Spaun, Schauffele nail down U.S. Ryder Cup spots
content: U.S. Open winner J.J. Spaun and two-time major champion Xander Schauffele will join world No. 1 golfer Scottie Scheffler on the U.S. team when it takes on Europe in next month's Ryder Cup.

title: Texas first No. 1 team to be underdog in Week 1
content: Texas took the top spot in the preseason AP Top 25 for the first time in program history but still enters Week 1 as an underdog vs. No. 3 Ohio State.

title: Steelers' Heyward hints at sitting out into season
content: Cam Heyward wants a raise, and the longtime Steelers defensive tackle indicated Monday he is open to sitting out regular-season games to get one.

title: Browns' Garrett cited for going 100 mph in 60 zone
content: Browns defensive end Myles Garrett was issued a citation for speeding on the interstate in a Cleveland suburb early Saturday morning, according to court records, after he was clocked going 100 mph in a 60 mph zone.

title: Driver dies after medical emergency during race
content: A veteran stock car driver at a North Carolina short track died over the weekend after suffering a medical emergency while competing in a race, officials said.

title: 49ers' Shanahan eyeing Week 6 return for Aiyuk
content: 49ers coach Kyle Shanahan on Monday projected a Week 6 return for star wide receiver Brandon Aiyuk, who tore the ACL and MCL in his right knee last season.

title: üíç Cristiano Ronaldo, fianc√©e share dazzling ring
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's bride-to-be Georgina Rodriguez revealed her engagement to the soccer star with a post showing her ring on Instagram.

title: What are the Cowboys doing?!? The Micah Parsons talks are just the latest in $100 million worth of mistakes
content: How much have the Cowboys cost themselves by being too slow to get contracts done with Parsons, Dak Prescott and CeeDee Lamb?

title: ESPN's preseason All-America team: The best at every position
content: With the 2025 season right around the corner, we break down the top players, from quarterback to kick returner.

title: Online predators prey on young athletes using sextortion
content: A Michigan teen was goaded into sharing an intimate photo that scammers threatened to expose unless he paid up.

title: Orlovsky ranks the best NFL QBs in seven different traits: Who makes each top-10 list?
content: Which NFL quarterbacks have the strongest arms, greatest accuracy and best rushing ability? Dan Orlovsky stacked the 10 best in seven skill areas.

title: MLB playoff contender tiers: The locks, teams with work to do and the long shots
content: As hot streaks and cold spells jumble the postseason picture, here's how sure we are that your team will be playing in October.

title: Where the NBA's biggest remaining free agents stand this offseason
content: The futures of Jonathan Kuminga, Josh Giddey and others remain in flux as the 2025-26 season draws closer.

title: The bloody life of a UFC Octagon
content: Since the UFC's birth in 1993, fighters, coaches and executives have come and gone. The one character that has never changed? The Octagon.

title: Matthew and Brady Tkachuk on Olympic gold, Canada rivalry and new NHL CBA
content: What's it like being on the cover of a video game with their dad? And what are their thoughts on the Winter Games?

title: Ranked: The top 50 players going into the new Premier League seasonÔªø
content: Ahead of the 2025-26 Premier League season, let's rank the best 50 players to keep an eye on. Liverpool and Arsenal dominate the list, but Man United managed some spots, too.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea to rival Man United for PSG keeper Donnarumma
content: Chelsea and Manchester United are set to go head to head for Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Alex Caruso marries 'Big Brother' alum Haleigh Broucher
content: The wedding marks Caruso's second ring of the summer, after helping the Thunder win the NBA Finals in June.

title: Pickups: Luke Keaschall's hot hitting leads weekly adds
content: As the MLB season moves beyond the trade deadline, here are the players you should be claiming off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: Waiver wire: Leila Lacan, Dominique Malonga among top pickups
content: Leila Lacan is an intriguing backcourt pickup for fantasy managers that need a boost, while Dominique Malonga continues to shine on the Storm.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Can anyone stop the Kansas City Current?
content: The KC Current extended their league lead to 12 points with 11 games remaining thanks to their 13th win of the season. Wow! That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: MLS Power Rankings: San Diego keeps climbing as rivals slip
content: Is San Diego the best expansion team in MLS history? Chucky Lozano & Co. rise in our latest rankings.

title: How Jordyn Jackson, Saniyah Hall fit at Maryland, USC
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including No. 1 Saniyah Hall and No. 8 Jordyn Jackson.

title: MLA Denied Ministerial Post Promised Before Polls: Telangana Deputy Chief Minister
content: A political can of worms is out in the open in the Telangana Congress after Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka, in a local TV interview, commented on Munugode MLA Komatireddy Rajagopal Reddy being denied a ministerial position.

title: Vikram Sarabhai's Legacy Powers India's First Private Satellite Constellation
content: The Indian National Space Promotion and Authorisation Centre (IN-SPACe) has selected a PixxelSpace India-led consortium to build and operate the country's first fully indigenous commercial Earth Observation (EO) satellite constellation.

title: Mumbai Boy Dies During Dahi Handi Practice
content: An 11-year-old member of a Govinda squad died after he fell during a practice session to form a human pyramid for the upcoming Dahi Handi festival in Mumbai.

title: Supreme Court Wants Stray Dogs Off Delhi Roads. But Where Are The Shelters
content: The Supreme Court's order to civic bodies in Delhi-NCR to relocate all stray dogs living in residential neighbourhoods to shelters has sparked a massive debate

title: Possessing Aadhaar, Voter ID Doesn't Make One Indian Citizen: Bombay High Court
content: A person does not become a citizen of India merely by possessing documents like Aadhaar card, PAN card or a voter ID, the Bombay High Court on Tuesday said while refusing bail to a man, allegedly from Bangladesh, for entering India illegally.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Delhi Has Zero State-Run Shelters. How Will It House 10 Lakh Stray Dogs?
content: It is not enough for the court to merely pass an order to make the streets of Delhi-NCR free of stray dogs. Indeed, the ruling will be meaningful only if the court takes all factors into account and exercises oversight every step of the way.

title: Israeli Planes, Tanks Bombard Gaza City Overnight As It Fights Starvation
content: Israeli planes and tanks kept bombarding eastern areas of Gaza City overnight, killing at least 11 people, witnesses and medics said on Tuesday, with Hamas leader Khalil Al-Hayya due in Cairo for talks to revive a US-backed ceasefire plan.

title: Amidst Declining Trade Ties With India, Bangladesh Seeks New Partners
content: Bangladesh and Malaysia signed five memoranda of understanding (MoUs) and exchanged three notes in different areas of cooperation-- including defence, trade, and education-- on the first day of Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus's three-day visit

title: Xi Jinping Takes Aim At US "Protectionism" In Phone Call With Brazil's Lula
content: Lula da Silva spoke with his Chinese counterpart following talks with the leaders of India and Russia, as part of his outreach to allies after Donald Trump thrust Latin America's biggest economy into the middle of his global trade war.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 17 Live Updates: Amid INDIA Bloc Leaders' Protest, Lok Sabha, Rajya Sabha Resume Proceedings
content: ¬†As the INDIA Bloc leaders continued to protest¬†Special Intensive Revision (SIR) issue of electoral rolls in Bihar, the proceedings of Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha have been resumed.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Seeds Of Sabotage: The 'Agro-Terrorism' Threat India Can't Ignore
content: If American and Chinese ongoing research in genetic engineering of food crops through insect dispersion is anything to go by, then India's security agencies have an additional danger of agro-terrorism on their already cluttered threat radar.

title: From France To Canada, List Of Countries That Recognise Palestine As A State
content: Almost 150 of the 193 UN members, including the majority of nations in Asia, Africa, and South America, recognise Palestinian statehood.

title: For Gaza Students, Big Ambitions Replaced By Desperate Search For Food
content: Student Maha Ali was determined to become a journalist one day and report on events in Gaza. Now she and other students have just one ambition: finding food as hunger ravages the Palestinian enclave.

title: "His Success Story Is Amazing": Trump Meets Intel CEO Days After Demanding His Resignation
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday said he had a "very interesting" meeting with the chief of US chip maker Intel, just days after calling for his resignation.

title: How Indian Armed Forces Get Ready For Independence Day Parade
content: The grand Independence Day parade is the result of months of planning, training, and coordination among the different branches of the military.

title: Mother Arrested For Leaving Infant's Strangled Body In Hearse At Funeral Home
content: A 29-year-old Alabama mother has been arrested and charged with capital murder after she allegedly dumped her infant daughter's strangled body into the back of a hearse parked outside a funeral parlour.

title: What Is Balochistan Liberation Army, Why US Designated It As 'Terror Group'
content: The BLA, seeking independence for Pakistan's resource-rich Balochistan province, has claimed responsibility for multiple attacks over the years.

title: Day After Stray Dogs Order, Ban On Leftover Food In Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court instructed authorities to dispose of leftover food in covered dustbins to prevent dogs from entering the court premises scavenging for food.

title: Opposition MPs Wear "124-Year-Old Minta Devi" Shirts. Poll Body Says "Error"
content: Several Opposition MPs wore T-shirts with 'Minta Devi' and her picture emblazoned on them and '124 Not Out' written at the back during a protest in the Parliament House complex against the Election Commission's voter roll revision in Bihar.

title: Study Reveals Impact Of Heat Extremes On Tropical Birds' Populations
content: The study found that while shifts in average temperature and rainfall have some influence, the biggest climate threat to birds, particularly in tropical regions, comes from exposure to extreme heat.

title: 'If we are going down ...': Pakistan threatens to target RIL‚Äôs Jamnagar refinery
content: Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, sparked controversy during his US visit by making anti-India remarks, including a threat to target Reliance's Jamnagar refinery. India strongly condemned Munir's "nuclear sabre-rattling" and questioned the safety of Pakistan's nuclear arsenal. Despite Pakistan's threats, India's military strength surpasses Pakistan's, with a larger active military and a growing nuclear arsenal.

title: Big 'Make in India' push! Cabinet approves four new semiconductor projects - details
content: The Union Cabinet has approved four new semiconductor projects under the India Semiconductor Mission, boosting the nation's ecosystem. These projects, with an investment of Rs 4,600 crore, include India's first commercial compound fabrication facility and an advanced glass-based substrate packaging unit.

title: Aadhaar 'not conclusive proof': SC backs EC in Bihar SIR; Sibal alleges ID rejection
content: The Supreme Court is currently reviewing petitions challenging the Election Commission's decision to conduct a Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar. Allegations of discrepancies, such as inaccuracies in voter status, have been raised by petitioners.

title: Devil lies in action: What makes Bumrah injury-prone - why his workload management is crucial
content: Since his 2018 Test debut, Jasprit Bumrah‚Äôs career has been plagued by recurring back injuries, beginning with a stress fracture in 2019. The problem resurfaced in 2022, forcing multiple long layoffs, surgery in 2023, and missed major tournaments. Earlier this year, back spasms sidelined him again, underlining the persistent toll his unique bowling action takes on his body.

title: OpenAI‚Äôs ‚Äòwarning shot‚Äô at Indian IT: Analyst says it could hit revenue model
content: OpenAI's GPT-5 launch poses a threat to India's IT sector, potentially causing a 2-3% revenue decline due to enhanced AI coding capabilities. While AI improves productivity and shifts billing models, firms face challenges adapting to outcome-based pricing. Experts predict short-term pain but long-term gains as new AI opportunities emerge, requiring IT firms to overhaul delivery models.

title: Retail inflation plunges! July 2025 CPI at 8-year low; food inflation slips to -1.76%
content: Retail inflation has plummeted to a notable 1.55% in July 2025, marking an eight-year low since June 2017. A significant drop in food prices, with the Consumer Food Price Index at -1.76%, contributed to this decline.

title: 'They call it a menace, we call it a heartbeat': Ritika on stray dogs directive
content: Ritika Sajdeh, wife of Rohit Sharma, has voiced her concerns over the Supreme Court's directive to relocate stray dogs in Delhi-NCR to shelters. She advocated for humane solutions like sterilisation and vaccination programs instead of caging the animals. The court's order mandates immediate capture and relocation, with strict measures against obstruction, aiming to create stray dog-free localities.

title: 'Vote chori' row: Thousands protest KN Rajanna‚Äôs removal from cabinet
content: KN Rajanna was removed from his cabinet post. This followed his criticism of Rahul Gandhi. Supporters protested across Karnataka. One person reportedly attempted self-immolation. Siddaramaiah removed Rajanna after Congress high command directive. DK Shivakumar raised concerns about Rajanna's statements. Rajanna questioned Rahul Gandhi's vote theft allegations. BJP MLA R Ashoka commented on the situation.

title: China to Nvidia CEO: Sorry Jensen Huang, just lobbying with Trump will not help...
content: China is advising domestic companies to avoid using Nvidia's H20 chips. This directive impacts government projects and challenges Nvidia and AMD's revenue recovery. The move raises concerns about security and promotes China's self-reliance in chip production. AMD's MI308 chips are also affected. Beijing questions the choice of US chips over local alternatives. Donald Trump calls the H20 chip obsolete.

title: Team India Test captain Gill named the ICC men's POTM for July 2025
content: Shubman Gill has been crowned ICC Men's Player of the Month for July 2025 following his stellar performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. As India's Test captain, Gill amassed 567 runs at an impressive average of 94.50, including a double century and two centuries. His remarkable Edgbaston innings featured a match total of 430 runs, contributing significantly to India's historic victory.

title: 'Ram was out of his mind': Tamil poet Vairamuthi's remarks sparks row
content: Lyricist Vairamuthu's recent remarks on Lord Ram, claiming he was 'out of his mind' after separating from Sita, have ignited controversy in Tamil Nadu. Vairamuthu's comments, made at a Kambar Kazhagam event, drew sharp criticism from TN BJP President Nainar Nagenthran, who deemed them 'anti-Hindu'.

title: Microsoft CEO to staff: 'Not enough to be software factory, must become‚Ä¶'
content: Microsoft is undergoing a significant shift, transitioning from a software manufacturer to an "intelligence engine," according to CEO Satya Nadella. This transformation aims to democratize AI, empowering global users to create their own intelligent tools. Microsoft will focus on building AI systems that enable individuals and organizations to develop customized solutions, redesigning its technology stack to support this new vision.

title: Fatehpur mausoleum row: SP expels Pappu Chauhan for 'anti-party activities'
content: Pappu Singh Chauhan, a Samajwadi Party leader, was expelled for engaging in "anti-party" activities following an FIR against him and others for attempting to vandalize a 200-year-old mausoleum in Fatehpur. Hindu right-wing members, claiming the site as a temple, created a disturbance.

title: Rohit Sharma tests speed of his most expensive car, fans go wild - WATCH
content: Indian cricket star Rohit Sharma recently added a striking red Lamborghini Urus SE to his impressive car collection. He was spotted driving the luxury SUV in Mumbai, attracting attention from fans. The personalised number plate, 3015, cleverly combines his children's birthdays and his iconic jersey number, 45.

title: MS Dhoni's secret to staying cool: 'Like a tin roof ... '
content: Ambati Rayudu shared an anecdote about MS Dhoni's leadership at CSK, recalling how Dhoni cautioned him against losing his cool and arguing with umpires to avoid Fair Play point deductions. Ironically, Rayudu revealed that Dhoni himself once stepped onto the field during a tense match when CSK was facing defeat.

title: New I-T Bill 2025: Income Tax Act 1961 to be replaced; what taxpayers should know
content: New Income Tax Bill 2025: The Lok Sabha has passed the New Income Tax Bill 2025, a major overhaul aimed at simplifying tax procedures for individuals and corporations. The revised bill, incorporating recommendations from a Parliamentary Select Committee, reduces text volume, streamlines the taxation timeline, and clarifies provisions for refunds and deductions.

title: 'Public safety, animal welfare go hand in hand': Rahul on SC's stray dog order
content: Rahul Gandhi opposed the Supreme Court's order on relocating stray dogs. He called it a step back from humane policies. The court directed that Delhi-NCR localities should be free of stray dogs. It also ordered no captured dogs to be released back. The court warned against obstructing the capture drive. Police detained animal rights activists protesting the decision at India Gate.

title: 'Don't buy Hamas numbers': Israeli envoy to Priyanka on 'murder' of journalists
content: Israel's Ambassador to India, Reuven Azar, strongly criticised Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra for her condemnation of the Israeli strike that killed Al Jazeera journalists, labeling her remarks as deceitful. Azar defended Israel's actions, stating they targeted Hamas terrorists and accused the group of using civilians as shields. Gandhi Vadra had accused Israel of committing genocide and criticized the Indian government's silence on the matter.

title: Gurgaon techie who flashed woman arrested; was returning from son's PTM
content: In a troubling incident, the Gurgaon police have taken into custody Abhilash Kumar, a 32-year-old MTech graduate, for allegedly harassing a woman at Rajiv Chowk on August 2nd. The assistant manager, hailing from Karnal, was arrested in Sector 49 after a meticulous investigation that included reviewing CCTV footage.

title: 'Process of removal should begin': Panel formed to probe Justice Varma cash row
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has formed a three-member committee to probe allegations against Justice Yashwant Varma related to a ‚Äúcash-at-home‚Äù controversy. The panel includes senior advocate P.V. Acharya, Justice Aravind Kumar of the Supreme Court, and Madras High Court Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava.

title: Taylor Swift and Sabrina Carpenter‚Äôs surprise collab: NFL fans go wild
content: Pop sensation Taylor Swift is set to release her new album, 'The Life of a Showgirl'. The album announcement was hinted at during Travis Kelce's podcast. A collaboration with Sabrina Carpenter is also in the works. Fans are eagerly awaiting Swift's full appearance on 'New Heights'. The album release is strategically timed with the NFL preseason.

title: ‚ÄòHusband‚Äôs sperm count too low‚Äô: Father-in-law, relative rape Gujarat woman
content: A Vadodara woman filed a police report. She accused her father-in-law and sister-in-law's husband of repeated rape. The motive was to impregnate her due to her husband's low sperm count. She also accused her husband of blackmail after a miscarriage. The incidents occurred between February and July 2024. Police have registered a First Information Report and are investigating the case.

title: Grok suspended over Gaza comments? Musk calls it ‚Äòdumb error‚Äô
content: Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, faced a brief suspension from X, sparking controversy after it attributed the removal to comments about Israel's actions in Gaza, citing ICJ rulings and UN reports. Musk dismissed this, attributing the suspension to a "dumb error.

title: Uttarakhand flash flood aftermath: Temporary lake formed in Harsil poses new risk
content: A temporary lake near Harsil, formed after the Dharali flash flood, poses a threat to downstream areas. Authorities are working to drain the lake safely. Geologists are assessing the lake's stability. SDRF personnel are clearing obstructions. The Army is overseeing operations. Road restoration is hampered by the lake and ongoing rain. NDMA has ordered constant surveillance and safe water release.

title: How much will Ronaldo have to pay if he splits with Georgina Rodriguez?
content: Georgina Rodr√≠guez, now engaged to Cristiano Ronaldo, has amassed a $10 million fortune through modelling, reality TV, and entrepreneurial ventures. Their engagement was announced on August 11 on Instagram. While Ronaldo boasts a billion-dollar net worth, safeguards are reportedly in place: Rodr√≠guez would receive a substantial monthly pension and Ronaldo's Madrid mansion if they separate.

title: ‚ÄòUnscientific and inhumane': Activists say SC order goes against govt's 2023 rule
content: Animal welfare activists are up in arms against a recent Supreme Court order mandating the relocation of stray dogs, citing violations of the Animal Birth Control Rules, 2023. They emphasize the absence of government-run dog shelters in Delhi-NCR and the impracticality of mass relocation without proper census data.

title: 'Don't want you to be comfortable': Did Trump just roast the press? Watch video
content: President Trump, during a press conference announcing the federalization of Washington, DC, dismissed a reporter's request for a larger press briefing room, jokingly stating he didn't want the press to be comfortable. This remark drew laughter from officials and reporters present. Trump also declared "Liberation Day in DC," vowing to eliminate crime and improve the capital.

title: Woman injured in tree fall dies after ambulance stuck for hours on pothole-ridden NH-48
content: Chhaaya Purav, 49, tragically died after a tree fell on her at her former school in Palghar. While being transported to a Mumbai hospital, the ambulance became trapped in a severe traffic jam on the pothole-filled Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway. The delay exacerbated her injuries, and she was pronounced dead upon arrival at a closer hospital.

title: Nasa teases major discovery: Mystery object speeds through solar system
content: NASA has shared new details about 3I/ATLAS. It is an interstellar object moving at 209,000 km/h. Hubble images show it is smaller than thought, about 5.6 km wide. It is a comet with a glowing tail. Scientists estimate it is eight billion years old. It poses no threat to Earth. NASA uses telescopes to study it.

title: Weed behind bars: Ganja-filled ball thrown into Maharashtra jail
content: A security lapse at Beed district prison led to a violent clash among four undertrial prisoners after an unidentified person threw a rubber ball filled with ganja into the facility. The inmates fought over the distribution of the contraband, prompting jail staff intervention and a police investigation.

title: Nitish Katara murder case: SC rules no jail beyond fixed term
content: The Supreme Court of India has mandated the immediate release of convicts across all states and union territories who have completed their court-mandated sentences, provided they are not implicated in other cases. This directive follows the court's concern about prisoners being detained beyond their sentence terms. The order was issued during the case of Sukhdev Yadav, convicted in the Nitish Katara murder, who finished his 20-year sentence in March.

title: How Indian cities tackle stray dog issue; Netherlands ended it with 'benchmark model'
content: The Supreme Court has mandated the removal of stray dogs in Delhi-NCR, directing their confinement to shelters. Various Indian cities employ different strategies, including sterilization programs, designated feeding zones, and compensation for bite victims. The Netherlands eradicated its stray dog issue through comprehensive measures like sterilization, strict animal welfare laws, and promoting adoption.

title: Fresh trouble for Nayara Energy: SBI stops trade & forex transactions
content: State Bank of India has ceased trade and foreign currency dealings with Nayara Energy due to potential US sanctions, prioritizing compliance with international rules. This decision, made after recent US tariff hikes and EU sanctions, impacts Nayara's international transactions. Nayara is now seeking alternative arrangements with domestic institutions like UCO Bank to navigate these challenges.

title: Who is Georgina Rodriguez? Cristiano Ronaldo‚Äôs fianc√©e
content: Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodriguez have announced their engagement after eight years together, Rodriguez shared the news on Instagram, showcasing a diamond ring. Their relationship began in 2016, and they share a blended family, including five children. Rodriguez, a model and influencer, stars in her own Netflix series, 'I Am Georgina'. The engagement marks a significant milestone in their journey.

title: ED faces 'wall of the dead' as Vadra puts burden on deceased colleagues
content: Robert Vadra, facing an Enforcement Directorate probe into land deals, has attributed key financial decisions to deceased associates, including Rajesh Khurana and H.L. Pahwa. This strategy mirrors responses from Sonia and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case, where they cited the late Motilal Vora's knowledge. The ED alleges Vadra was evasive and suppressed information regarding transactions.

title: 'Can‚Äôt cross some red lines': Govt officials on India-US trade talks
content: India is engaged in trade discussions with the US, reaffirming its commitment to resolving pending matters through dialogue, while firmly maintaining certain non-negotiable positions. Despite challenges in Indo-US trade relations, India is actively diversifying its export strategies, leveraging existing trade agreements and exploring new partnerships with countries like EFTA and the UK.

title: ‚ÄòPay in Bitcoin‚Äô: Blue Origin opens crypto bookings; Bezos bets on digital space tourism
content: Blue Origin now accepts cryptocurrency, including Bitcoin and Ethereum, for its New Shepard space tourism flights, partnering with Shift4 Payments for secure transactions. This move allows customers to book flights with digital currencies, requiring a $150,000 deposit. The initiative aims to broaden accessibility and integrate crypto into the luxury space travel market, offering an 11-minute suborbital experience.

title: 'Tied her to bike with her dupatta': Man who rode 80km in rain with wife's body
content: Amit Yadav, a construction labourer, tragically carried his wife's body on his motorcycle for 80km after a hit-and-run accident on the Nagpur-Jabalpur highway. Amidst heavy rain and a police chase, Amit sought help after the accident in a remote area of Pench tiger reserve.

title: Bandipur: 50-year-old man alights from car to take elephant's pic, trampled
content: A man had a close brush with death inside Bandipur Tiger Reserve when he was attacked by a tusker. Basavaraj, a resident of Nanjangud, alighted from his vehicle near Kekkanahalla and was charged by the elephant, which was guarding its calf. The incident, captured on video, shows the tusker knocking Basavaraj down and trampling him.

title: Pune pickup van accident: Truck falls into ditch; 10 killed, 27 injured
content: A tragic accident near Pune claimed the lives of ten women and injured 27 others when a pick-up truck carrying devotees to the Kundeshwar temple plunged into a ditch. The overloaded vehicle, transporting over 35 people, reportedly slipped on a steep incline while navigating the ghat section.

title: Porn clip runs during online meeting of teachers with UP DM; FIR filed
content: An online public meeting of the education department in Maharajganj, chaired by the district magistrate, was disrupted by unidentified participants who played a pornographic video and made objectionable remarks. The incident occurred during an e-Chaupal session, leading to the registration of an FIR against two individuals. Authorities are investigating the cybercrime and working to identify the perpetrators.

title: 'Not doing well': Trump calls tariffs on India over Russian oil 'big blow' to Moscow
content: Donald Trump claimed that US tariffs on India for purchasing Russian oil significantly impacted Moscow's economy, highlighting a 50% duty on Delhi. He stated that Russia's economy is struggling due to global pressures and the conflict. Trump mentioned a potential meeting with Russia to discuss resolution, noting European leaders' desire to end the conflict and focus on their own economies.

title: Priyanka condemns Israel for 'cold-blooded murder' of Al Jazeera reporters
content: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra condemned the Israeli strike that killed five Al Jazeera journalists, labeling it a "cold-blooded murder." She lauded the reporters' dedication to truth, accusing Israel of silencing them before a planned Gaza offensive. Israel has long accused Al Jazeera of being a Hamas mouthpiece, a claim the network denies.

title: Kashmiri Pandits' exodus: Raids at 8 locations over 1990 murder of Sarla Bhat
content: The State Investigation Agency (SIA) conducted raids in central Kashmir, targeting former members of the banned JKLF, as part of their investigation into the 1990 murder of Sarla Bhat, a Kashmiri Pandit woman. Bhat disappeared from her hostel in April 1990, and her body was later discovered in Srinagar.

title: 'Freeze their assets': Canada‚Äôs opposition seeks terror tag for Bishnoi gang
content: Canada's Conservative Party is pressing Prime Minister Mark Carney to classify the Lawrence Bishnoi gang as a terrorist entity following a surge in violent incidents and extortion attempts impacting South Asian communities in British Columbia, Alberta, and Ontario. Allegedly linked to organized crime, the gang has claimed responsibility for shootings, including attacks on Kapil Sharma's caf√©.

title: Expert panel has recommended that India doesn't fall within criteria for adopting malaria vaccines: Govt
content: Minister of State for Health Anupriya Patel was responding to a question on whether India's first malaria vaccine has received regulatory approval for use in the country

title: Karnataka rains: Water enters Saundatti Yallamma temple in Belagavi district, hundi submerged
content: Bank notes were kept in the open all around the temple to dry. All the bank notes were covered in saffron and vermilion

title: Pune varsity withdraws 'Voice of Devendra' competition notice after objection from NSUI
content: The university's National Social Scheme wing had uploaded a notification on its website to take part in the elocution competition organised under the title "Voice of Devendra", taking inspiration from Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis.

title: John Abraham writes to CJI, calls for review of Supreme Court‚Äôs directive on stray dogs
content: The letter came a day after the Supreme Court directed the authorities to permanently relocate all strays from streets to shelters ‚Äúat the earliest‚Äù

title: Drone entrepreneurship programme for Ex-servicemen launched
content: As part of the entrepreneurship development programme Dhaksha Drones will provide drones to the ex-servicemen after imparting training to the beneficiaries

title: Parliamentary proceedings: Raising FDI limit for insurers to 100% will generate employment opportunities, says FM Sitharaman
content: The Insurance Act, 1938 governs investment by insurers with a strong emphasis on safety, liquidity, and regulatory oversight by aligning investment by insurers with policyholder interests

title: Catholic Congress slams CPI(M) Kerala secretary M.V. Govindan over remarks against Archbishop Joseph Pamplany
content: Father Kaviyil Philip, global director of Catholic Congress, says Govindan ‚Äòshould not speak like Govindachamy‚Äô

title: Union Cabinet approves four new semiconductor projects worth ‚Çπ4,594 crore
content: The Union Minister said ‚ÄúThe six projects that were previously approved have a capacity of producing 24 billion chips annually‚Äù

title: TDP MPs, MLAs urge HM Amit Shah to renew FCRA of RDT
content: The TDP delegation appraised Mr. Amit Shah about the service activities of the RDT and how the activities have brought a change in the life of the people of the region over the last five decades

title: DMK government‚Äôs rush to implement welfare schemes before polls reflects its fear of defeat: Nainar Nagenthran
content: Speaking to the media in Chennai, Mr. Nagenthran alleged that murders have become a daily occurence in Tamil Nadu under the DMK rule

title: Uttarkashi flash floods: NGRI experts launch search operation to trace 66 missing in disaster-hit Dharali
content: NGRI experts use Ground Penetrating Radars to locate missing people in Uttarkashi flood disaster, with rescue operations ongoing

title: BJP MP petitions ECI on C.M. Ibrahim‚Äôs claim of helping Siddaramaiah win 2018 Assembly poll in Badami by ‚Äòbuying‚Äô 3,000 votes
content: Pointing out that Siddaramaiah won the election by a narrow margin of 1,696 votes, BJP MP Lahar Singh described Ibrahim‚Äôs claims of ‚Äòvote purchase‚Äô as an ‚Äòalleged electoral crime‚Äô

title: Owaisi condemns Pakistan Army chief Asim Munir‚Äôs remarks, demands political response from Modi government
content: Asaduddin Owaisi said India being a strategic partner, this misuse of American soil is unacceptable to India and Indians; he demanded Centre raise the issue strongly with the U.S.

title: No plans to declare cow national animal: Centre tells Parliament
content: ‚ÄúNo, Sir. As per Article 246(3) of the Constitution, under the distribution of legislative powers between the Union and the States, the preservation of animals is a matter on which the State legislature has exclusive powers to legislate,‚Äù Union Minister S.P. Singh Baghel said in a written reply to Parliament

title: Watch: Elector deletions after SIR in Bihar: Many problematic questions emerge: Data Point
content: In this video, The Hindu Data Team unpacks the district-level data, charts key trends, and explores these key trends that emerge from the analysis

title: Parliamentary panel on simultaneous elections gets extension till last week of winter session
content: According to the motion, the panel has been given time till up to the first day of last week of the Winter session, 2025, to present its report.

title: CM Stalin launches Thayumanavar scheme in T.N. to deliver ration products at doorsteps of elderly, disabled people
content: Essential commodities from ration shops would be delivered at the doorsteps of the beneficiaries on the second Saturday and Sunday of every month.

title: Withdrawal of Punjab land pooling policy victory of farmers, labourers: BJP
content: ‚ÄòThey (Delhi-based AAP leaders) brought the land pooling policy to loot Punjab,‚Äô says Punjab BJP leader Ashwani Sharma

title: Congress in Kerala lodges police complaint against Union Minister Suresh Gopi, alleges electoral fraud
content: Former Thrissur MP T.N. Prathapan files complaint seeking criminal probe against Suresh Gopi on charge of filing false affidavit claiming more than six months‚Äô domicile in the Lok Sabha constituency ahead of filing nomination in 2024 polls

title: Assam to have 10 new co-districts
content: The initiative aims to bring essential services closer to citizens, improve administrative efficiency and strengthen the delivery of public welfare, the CMO said in a post

title: BJP MP C. Sadanandan, CPI(M) leader M.V. Jayarajan trade barbs
content: Sadanandan writes in a Facebook post that the CPI(M) leader‚Äôs ‚Äòarmy‚Äô will not be enough to prevent the former‚Äôs political rise. Jayarajan earlier likened Sadanandan to Pragya Singh Thakur

title: Supreme Court‚Äôs directive on stray dogs a step back from humane, science-backed policy: Rahul
content: ‚ÄúShelters, sterilisation, vaccination & community care can keep streets safe - without cruelty. Blanket removals are cruel, shortsighted, and strip us of compassion,‚Äù Rahul Gandhi said

title: Schoolgirl 'gang-raped' in Odisha, relative among five detained
content: The relative of the minor told her to visit a temple in the nearby village, but had taken her to the crime site, police said

title: Begusarai Congress party unit claims 37 deceased electors found in draft SIR voters list at one booth
content: Begusarai Congress unit submits list of deceased electors, demands corrections in draft electoral roll and seeks extended deadline for rectifications

title: Justice Varma cash row: Lok Sabha Speaker announces three-member inquiry panel
content: The three-member committee includes Justice Arvind Kumar of the Supreme Court, Justice Manindra Mohan Srivastava, Chief Justice of the Madras High Court and Senior Advocate of Karnataka High Court B.V. Acharya

title: Shameful that Indian Government silent as Israel unleashes devastation on people of Palestine: Priyanka Gandhi
content: Priyanka Gandhi said the "cold blooded murder" of five Al Jazeera journalists is another heinous crime committed on Palestinian soil

title: War of words breaks out between CPI(M), Church leadership in Kerala over ‚ÄòSangh Parivar affinity‚Äô
content: Row centres around CPI(M)‚Äòs accusations that certain bishops show a predilection towards Modi and Shah, while ‚Äòturning a blind eye to attacks‚Äô against Christians and clergy by Hindu right-wing organisations in BJP-ruled States

title: Sports Bill will result in extreme centralisation of sports administration, says Congress
content: Jairam Ramesh alleged that the BCCI will get the most favoured treatment, not subject to any laws of the land like the RTI

title: Guntur to host a 10-Km national flag display in Har Ghar Tiranga programme
content: The Commissioner said the initiative would instil patriotism among citizens and remind the youth and students of India‚Äôs freedom struggle, urging everyone to take part in the historic display

title: Pilots‚Äô union urges DGCA to withdraw notice period proposal before global body
content: The pilot‚Äôs body says that implementing a notice period risks turning aviation personnel into bonded labourers in a duopoly

title: Body of man accused of killing his sisters¬†found in river in Kerala‚Äôs Kannur
content: Police say Pramod had been caring for his sisters, both of whom suffered from health issues, and is believed to have killed them when he could no longer continue doing so

title: Bhubaneswar-based CIFA to¬†lead multi-country effort to improve livelihood of aquaculture farmers
content: The project will directly benefit over 1,20,000 rural households, 30% of which comprise women, across Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Nepal and Sri Lanka, says CIFA

title: NLCIL signs MoU with Bhabha Atomic Research Centre for extraction of rare earth elements from fly ash
content: According to NLCIL, under this agreement, a pilot project will be established at Neyveli with technical support from BARC to demonstrate the process of extracting rare earth elements from fly ash, a by-product of thermal power generation

title: Naveen Patnaik expresses concerns over disturbing pattern of girls‚Äô suicides in Odisha
content: Congress forms three fact-finding teams to look into incidences of rape, sexual harassment and suicide in Balasore, Nabarangpur, and Bargarh dists

title: Kerala moves Supreme Court against Governor‚Äôs appointment of interim Vice-Chancellor to APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University
content: The Chancellor appointed Dr. K. Sivaprasad solely according to his choice and not based on the recommendation of the Government, contends Kerala

title: India monsoon rains LIVE: Heavy rains lash Jammu region, schools shut in Rajouri, Reasi, Poonch districts
content: Uttarkashi rescue operations affected due to incessant rainfall; Dehradun administrations declares leave for schools after heavy rains; Kedarnath Yatra remains suspended due to rains

title: Overnight downpour drenches Telangana, Warangal‚Äôs Kapulakanaparthy records 21.8 cm rain
content: According to data from the Telangana Development Planning Society (TGDPS), between 8.30 a.m. of August 11 and 8 a.m. of August 12, Kapulakanaparthy in Warangal district recorded the highest rainfall of 21.8 cm.

title: Musi River overflow shuts Chaderghat causeway; Hyderabad traffic police suggests alternative routes
content: Authorities said the closure of  Chaderghat causeway was necessary after heavy rains caused a surge in the river‚Äôs flow, making the causeway unsafe for travel

title: Minor spark in cargo flight engine at Chennai airport
content: Smoke was observed coming from one of the engines upon landing, which led some sections of the media to report a major fire on board. However, officials from the Airports Authority of India (AAI) clarified that there was no major fire

title: Manipur: 5 policemen suspended for 'grave misconduct', 'dereliction of duty'
content: Officials privy with the matter said that the suspension was linked to bribery related to release of drug peddlers after being caught with narcotics

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 17 LIVE: Three bills in debate as Opposition protests Bihar SIR
content: Lok Sabha has formed a committee to probe into charges concerning Allahabad HC Judge Yashwant Varma‚Äôs removal

title: 36 years on, police raid 8 locations in Kashmiri Pandit nurse‚Äôs killing case in Srinagar
content: Sarla Bhat, who went missing from her hostel at the Sher-e-Kashmir Institute of Medical Sciences at Soura in April 1990, was found dead in downtown Srinagar

title: Maharashtra women rights ground demand action over alleged police brutality, casteist abuse in Pune¬†
content: Three Dalit women in Pune‚Äôs Kothrud area were allegedly assaulted, caste abused, and illegally detained by police while their home was searched without a warrant.

title: Bihar SIR row hearing LIVE: This may be the largest disfranchisement exercise in India‚Äôs history, says Yogendra Yadav
content: The Election Commission said it was ‚Äútaking every possible step‚Äù to prevent the exclusion of any legitimate voter from the rolls

title: India must remain proactive in countering combined naval threat from China, Pakistan: Parliamentary Panel
content: The "strengthening of the China-Pakistan naval nexus" not only facilitates joint military exercises, but also "advances Pakistan's naval modernisation"

title: India, Kazakhstan discuss ways to boost defence cooperation, military ties
content: They agreed that the defence partnership between both sides was robust and dynamic with great potential for enhancement through collaboration and innovation

title: No compensation paid to Wayanad farmer family: Minister
content: His clarification came after members from the Opposition accused the government of discriminating in awarding compensation in man-animal conflicts.

title: Olympiad on astronomy, astrophysics to start from August 12
content: The Olympiad, being hosted by Homi Bhabha Centre for Science Education, will be held at the Jio World Convention Centre

title: ‚ÄòVote theft‚Äô claim of Congress factually incorrect: Election Commission
content: The evidence included video testimonials of representatives of political parties such as the RJD, the Congress, and the CPI.

title: Telangana to constitute committee to resolve the impasse in film industry
content: Panel will hold discussions with all stakeholders to evolve amicable solution, says Cinematography Minister Venkat Reddy

title: Zero tolerance for students who violate U.S. laws, says Consul General Laura Williams ¬†
content: Inaugurating the 2025-EducationUSA universities fair here, she expressed happiness at the student turnout, their interest in varied disciplines and to study in the U.S.

title: Telugu film shoots hit pause over 30% wage hike stalemate
content: With the ongoing strike, the industry is staring at the possibility of inevitable delays of films currently under production.

title: Small tablet, big impact: Telangana kicks off mega deworming drive for nearly 1 crore children
content: Programme‚Äôs objectives are improving nutritional status, cognitive development and overall health, reducing school absenteeism and promoting hygiene and sanitation practices to prevent reinfection

title: Virtual split in Akali Dal as its breakaway faction names party president
content:
Party rebels declare former Akal Takht acting chief priest Giani Harpreet Singh as president
at Amritsar meeting, sparking claims and counterclaims about which faction is ‚Äòreal‚Äô Akali Dal

title: R.G. Kar protest rally: two Kolkata doctors appear before police
content: Dr. Punya Brata Gun and Dr. Tamonas Chaudhuri are associated with Abhaya Mancha, a civil society group formed to seek justice for the R.G. Kar victim

title: ‚ÄòUnscientific‚Äô: animal rights groups on Supreme Court ruling on stray dogs
content: Former Union Minister and animal rights activist Maneka Gandhi said that the Delhi government would need to find up to 2,000 centres to accommodate tens of thousands of community dogs

title: SC refuses to intervene in Bombay HC ban on feeding of pigeons in ‚Äòkabutarkhanas‚Äô
content: Bench says a parallel hearing on the issue won‚Äôt be proper as proceedings are already pending before the High Court

title: Thanks to Chennai and its unique Margazhi season, my art found an anchor: Sudha Ragunathan
content: I could be travelling to the most exotic country in the world, but my heart always yearns to return home ‚Äî to the city and its warmth!

title: Sacking of Rajanna exposes Congress‚Äô ‚Äòanti-Dalit‚Äô face, says BJP
content: The BJP has maintained that the sacking of Scheduled Tribes leader K.N. Rajanna from the Cabinet over his views on ‚Äúvoter theft‚Äù had revealed the ‚Äútrue anti-Dalit face‚Äù of the Congress

title: Water Resources department plans to install artificial recharge shafts to replenish groundwater sources across Tamil Nadu
content: The State government recently approved the proposal to install nearly 576 artificial recharge shafts in 23 districts at a cost of ‚Çπ6.74 crore

content: ‚ÄúOffenders posing risks to public health must be prosecuted under the relevant provisions of the Food Safety and Standards Act; criminal proceedings will be initiated against the most serious violators,‚Äù says CM

title: 2025 PLL Playoffs: Bracket, schedule, teams and players to watch
content: the 2025 premier lacrosse league regular season is complete . the playoff bracket is set for the Maryland Whipsnakes, Philadelphia Waterdogs and California Redwoods . each team gets at least one week off now, with the two top seeds earning a bye .

title: Bhutto issues warning to India over Indus; follows Munir‚Äôs N-threat
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 2025 Fantasy Football Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .

title: What it's like to be coached by Bill Belichick
content: former second-round pick was a free agent for the first time in his career . he had endured countless ankle injuries, and his goal was to protect his body . the new coach was rumored to be tough, and he was supposedly unapproachable .

title: AP preseason poll reaction: One big number for every team
content: the first AP poll of the 2025 college football season has been released . Texas begins the season at No. 1 followed by Penn State, Ohio State, Clemson and Georgia . the defending champion and third-ranked Ohio State is a rematch of last season's college football playoff semifinal .

title: Projecting the top 10 freshmen for the 2025 season
content: the start of the college football season is approaching . many true freshmen are battling for roles -- or even starting spots -- on their teams . it didn't take long for Jeremiah Smith and Ryan Williams to establish themselves as difference-makers .

title: NFL preseason Week 1 takeaways: Tyler Shough's debut a mixed bag for Saints
content: the 2025 preseason kicked off Thursday and continued through Sunday . several rookies played their first snaps, whether they were rookies or offseason acquisitions . quarterback jamaree Caldwell has shown why the Chargers selected him .

title: Ultimate Fantasy Football Cheat Sheet: Print. Draft. Win.
content: the ultimate ESPN fantasy football cheat sheet is a curated rundown of all the names we've been talking about this preseason . if you want to read more about sleepers, busts, rookies, backups, value picks and more, the analysis is available for you to pore through .

title: NFL Future Power Rankings: We stacked all 32 teams' long-term expectations
content: in our annual Future Power Rankings, we ranked which teams are primed to be among the league's best over the next three seasons (2025 through 2027) each of the four categories was weighted to create the overall score: quarterback (20%), roster (30%), front office (25%) and coaching (25%). the results are based on how well each team is positioned for the future.
